windows.symptom: BSOD Unexpected Kernel trap, did everything I could think of and still BSOD        I keep getting repeated BSOD on my machine. I've did MEMtest and it was good, I updated my BIOS, I did chkdsk, I did a sfc /scan, I updated my drivers, Intel driver assistance said all my drivers are updated and I ran out of what to do.
solutions: Hi Johnny The minidump file indicates sbwfw.sys as the cause of your system crashes, that is a component of ThreatTrack Security or possibly some 3rd party Firewall you have installed on your systemThe best option is to remove that software and see if your system stabilizes . . .

windows.symptom: Windows Store Apps won't Install        Every time I try to download an app from the store, it gets as far as the end of the download bar and then says "app cannot install, will try again later". I click the retry button and it doesn't change the outcome.  This is the message I get when I click on 'show details'.How do I fix this?
solutions: Hi _Sharina, You can check if windows firewall is disabled, if firewall is disabled the windows store won't allow you to download apps.If that does not work you can try restarting Windows Store service. 1. Go to start, type Run then type services.msc. 2. Look for WSService then restart it. You can also try to reset the cache of windows store. Run CMD as administrator, type WSReset.exe and hit Enter. https://www.thewindowsclub.com/reset-windows-st...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it. Let me know how it works for you.

Hi Sharina,You can try the following solutions to fix.Solution 11. Click windows search bar > type in Windows PowerShell. Right click PowerShell and select run as administrator. Press yes.2. Copy below texts:Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers -Name Microsoft.WindowsStore | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml" -Verbose}Right click the white frame > Select edit > Paste above texts > type exit > press EnterRestart your computer. Solution 2Type wsreset in the windows search bar, and then click on “wsreset”Now wait for windows store to be repaired. Close the windows store.Done! Solution 3Click Settings > hit Apps  > Apps & features, and then scroll down to find Microsoft Store.Click on Microsoft Store > Select Advanced Options.Click Reset to rest Microsoft Store.A little wait to get error fixed.Solution 4Type CMD in the Windows search bar, right-click command prompt and select run as administrator. Press yes, and then type:  net stop wuauserv   ---  Press EneterEnter below command and press Enter in order.net stop cryptsvc net stop bitsnet stop msiserverren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.oldren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.old nest start wuausery net start cryptsvcnet start bitsnet start msiserverexitClick windows search bar > type in Windows PowerShell. Right click PowerShell and select run as administrator. Press yes. There you type:wuauclt.exe/updatenow --- Press EnterType:exit --- Press Enter

Every time I try to download an app from the store, it gets as far as the end of the download bar and then says "app cannot install, will try again later". I click the retry button and it doesn't change the outcome.  This is the message I get when I click on 'show details'.How do I fix this? Hello, Try re-registering Store app. Perform these steps: 1. Search for Windows PowerShell using Cortana or Windows Search. 2. From results, right click on Windows PowerShell and select Run as administrator. 3. Then type following command and press Enter key: Get-AppXPackage *WindowsStore* -AllUsers | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml"} Let the command complete. 4. Close Windows PowerShell. Let me know if issue still persists!

Hello, To fix high CPU usage issue, please refer these steps: Try to identify the process creating this issue. Download Process Explorer from Microsoft: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/process-explorer Run the tool then select the system process, right-click and select Properties. Switch to the Threads tab. This will show which file is using the excessive CPU usage, from which you can then attempt to diagnose it. Also refer: https://www.kapilarya.com/fix-windows-10-high-cpu-usage-problemLet us know if this helps!Note: Included link in this reply refers to blog post by a trusted Microsoft MVP.

windows.symptom: Windows 7 Pro to Windows 10 Enterprise upgrade licensing        Hi All,my company is using Windows 7 Pro and want to buy open license to Windows 10 Enterpriseis it just buy WINENTperDVC SNGL UpgrdSAPk OLP NL?as i know win 7 pro need upgrade to win 10 pro first and then upgrade to windows 10 ent, i dont know if VLSC provided the windows 10 pro software to let me upgrade to win 10 ent
solutions: We mainly help home users here.Upgrading to Enterprise, which uses Volume Licensing, is done via Software Assurance.Your question is outside the scope of this Community.Microsoft Volume Licensing Service CentersMicrosoft Volume Licensing Activation Centers worldwide telephone numbersSoftware Assurance FAQ@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Wrong Community for your Question and we don't work for Microsoft..What is the Microsoft Open License Program?Open Value Open Value is the recommended program if you have a small to midsize organization with five or more desktop PCs and want to simplify license management, manage software costs, and get better control over your investment. It also includes Software Assurance, providing access to valuable benefits such as training, deployment planning, software upgrades, and product support help you boost the productivity of your entire organization.Cheers.

windows.symptom: Resetting Password        I opened up my old windows vista home premium sony laptop but do not remember the admin password or the the regular password. How do i recover my password? Ive tried doing the startup repair method and the safe mode method but they dont work for me. I have valuable data on it and cannot afford to reset windows
solutions: I opened up my old windows vista home premium sony laptop but do not remember the admin password or the the regular password. How do i recover my password? Ive tried doing the startup repair method and the safe mode method but they dont work for me. I have valuable data on it and cannot afford to reset windows That's the whole idea WHY you have a Password: to protect your valuable data.We can't help you.Take the laptop to a computer repair shop with proof of ownership and they may be able to help you."What to do if you forget your Windows password"http://windows.microsoft.com/is-IS/windows-vista/What-to-do-if-you-forget-your-Windows-password"If you forget the administrator password and don't have a password reset disk or another administrator account, you won't be able to reset the password. If there are no other user accounts on the computer, you won't be able to log on toWindows and will need to re-install Windows."@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Microsoft forbids any assistance being given in these Forums to help you bypass or "crack" lost or forgotten Passwords.Here is the Microsoft Information outlining that Policy:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-security/keeping-passwords-secure-microsoft-policy-on/39f56ef0-5d68-41ad-9daa-6e6019c25d37Cheers.

I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.See the fixes here, one of which will always work to restore the shell User folder to Default location even if you have to reconstruct it from scratch:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/23504-resto...Don't accept the offer to copy the files back or it will copy everything on D drive. windows.symptom: My PC can’t startup normally        Hi there, im JohnyAbout three days ago, I have downloaded duet display but it require my PC to restart and then I can’t get access to my home screen any more. In my opinion, my PC got overload because it very weak or it lost some drivers. Please help me!Thank you!Johny
solutions: What is duet display and why are you using it?

Hey Johny. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Unplug power and remove battery, press and hold power button for 30 seconds to release all power from circuitry, plug back in and power up to see if any change.I will give you steps to access the Repair Mode to try all repairs to get Windows started, and if not to do the automated Reset or the superior Clean Install after rescuing your files.1) Use whichever method works in this link to access Advanced Startup Options: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/2294-advanc.... Easiest may be to force shut down the PC (by holding in the power button) three separate times to trigger the Startup Options. If one of these methods work, then go to Step 3.2) If none of the other methods work it may be necessary to Create Windows 10 Installation Media on another PC following the steps in the middle of the downloads page here:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Make sure to uncheck the box for Recommended Settings to choose only the licensed version.Insert media, boot it by powering up PC while pressing the BIOS Boot Menu Key: https://www.sysnative.com/forums/hardware-tutor... Choose the boot device as a UEFI device if offered, then on second screen choose Repair Your Computer. If the media won't boot you may need to enter BIOS/UEFI Setup (pressing key given in chart in link above) to turn off Fast Boot or Fast Startup first. There is always a way to get the media booted and I will guide you until it does, even if necessary to reset the BIOS to defaults via several methods.3) In the Advanced Troubleshooting options try to System Restore to a point before the problems began, try the new Uninstall Updates button, then Startup Repair, then if necessary from Startup Settings try to get into Safe Mode with Networking, or lastly Safe Mode. If Startup Settings aren't available you can force Safe Mode from the Command Prompt following Step 5 here:https://www.digitalcitizen.life/4-ways-boot-saf..., or using the command to unhide F8 Advanced Boot Options here:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/22455-enabl... where you can also try the old reliable Last Known Good Configuration.4) From Safe Mode w/Networking work through the Windows 10 Install Integrity Checklist to make sure the install is set up correctly, optimized for best performance, and any needed repairs get done:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... Update your drivers from the PC's Support Downloads web page. Compare the latest drivers with the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu. Make sure you have the latest BIOS, Chipset, Display (Video), Sound, USB3, Bluetooth, Network and all other drivers, or else download and install the latest now.5) If Safe Mode doesn’t work or help stabilize things then return to Advanced Troubleshoot options. Next try Command Prompt to run through Windows 10 Install Integrity Checklist (above link) Step 10 repair commands including sfc /scannow, DISM, a full Disk Check: https://www.groovypost.com/howto/check-hard-dri..., or return to Troubleshoot options to Reset Your Windows 10 PC.6) Better yet use the same booted media to do the vastly superior Clean Install following the steps in this link to delete all partitions down to Unallocated Space to get it cleanest:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... 7) There is a step to Rescue Files from the booted media or Repair Mode Command Prompt first:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... These steps are excerpted from my tutorial that compiles everything possible for Troubleshooting Windows 10 Failure to Start:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... You can continue with the other steps there.To test hardware, Dell and HP have onboard diagnostics triggered by powering up and pressing the F12 and ESC key respectively.Test the RAM overnight to stress it with the best bootable test memtest86, following these steps which test both the sticks and the slots:https://www.wikihow.com/Test-PC-RAM-with-MemTest86Test the hard drive with diagnostics: https://www.lifewire.com/free-hard-drive-testin...Best is to use the manufacturer's own if there is one, otherwise use Seatools bootable long test:http://blog.nowherelan.com/2013/04/04/boot-seat... Follow this up with a full Disk Check: https://www.groovypost.com/howto/check-hard-dri... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer There are links to a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Windows Media Player error - Encountered a problem while burning the file to disc.        I've been using Audacity to transfer my vinyl to digital and then burning the music tracks to CD-R discs. I successfully completed this task for the first 7 albums. Then all of a sudden I get this error. The first attempt was for just one song. I attempted again and it was for 3 different songs. I exported the files again from Audacity and used a different disc. Same issue, with three songs receiving the error. No idea why this is suddenly happening. It takes a great deal of time to create the tracks. Hate to start over. Help????
solutions: Don't use Windows Media Player.If you have iTunes, you can use that instead.  Otherwise, ImgBurn (free) is a good choice (http://www.imgburn.com/).On Audacity's "Help" menu, click Quick Help > Burn to a CD for an overview.  This includes instructions for using iTunes to burn an audio CD.If you intend to create audio CDs, see this ImgBurn guide:  http://forum.imgburn.com/index.php?/topic/5555-how-to-write-an-audio-cd-from-music-files-using-imgburn/
When this issue appeared did you try the old trick of shutting down the computer and re-booting it ?Many times this will sort out glitches that appear from time to time.

Thanks. I attempted the media player with another album with same results. So I downloaded imgburn. Not particularly user friendly...didn’t keep the track order, or album name, or track names, so had to enter custom labels for album, artist and tracks....but it works. Appreciate the assist.

Thanks....one of the first things I attempted. I’m always amazed with the bugs that pop up in Microsoft....and the lack of any detail with their errors....which is why I’m primarily a Mac user now. But I have my turntable set up in a room with an old HP....

One possibility is the media player.  Instead of WMP, download VLC.  VLC is freeware and one of the best media players available.Second possibility is that your CD drive has failed.I have been servicing hundreds of PCs for years.  I have yet to see this be a software problem.   CD/DVD drives are delicate and fail often.   Laptops:  Expensive to replace the component because it is a unique part only available from the OEM.  Better solution is to buy an external DVD drive.  Typically under $30, quite portable and small.  Buy the one that does not require a separate power source Desktops:  Easy and cheap to fix.  Cost about $20,  Quite universally shaped and sized.Properly shut downPull the power cordLay it on the side down where the wires areHold the ON button in for at least 7 secondsOpen the side on top -- usually 2 Phillips head screwsYou may have to remove the front too.  Typically it is held in place by clips that you will see on the inside edge, after removing the side panel.  Just carefully lift those clips to release the front panelUndo the 2 different plugs in the back of the CD unitRemove the 2 Phillips head screws that hold it in the chassisSlide it out.  It is considered hazardous waste.Reverse the procedure to install the new one.Windows will install the driver itself -- you do not need to install any software.

Thank you. I don’t think it’s the drive as it works with ImgBurn, another freeware suggested in another reply. It’s not the most user friendly...need to reenter track names etc.  Are you familiar with it?  I’ll continue using it unless you believe VLC would offer other benefits. Thanks again.

windows.symptom: "Free up space" Hard drive option difficulty        Attempted to use the "free up space" option in my storage and its stuck saying "Purging: Compress your OS drive"
solutions: Hi Nic. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.I would not compress the C drive as it can cause Windows not to start. I will give you steps to free up space on smaller drives and when necessary perform version Updates on them manually by the most stable method that requires much less space than Windows Update.First here are tips for managing smaller drives including the 32-gb SSD which they should have never allowed Windows 10 be installed upon:https://www.theguardian.com/technology/askjack/...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3040404/windows...https://www.groovypost.com/howto/maximize-stora...As more space becomes needed, you can move your User folders to another internal hard drive you have or install, or Desktop, Documents and Pictures folders into OneDrive and then set them to On Demand so they reside in the cloud and only have download links on the PC: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/116029-turn...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3233488/windows...You can also offload User folders (Documents, Music, Pictures, etc) to another drive you can install on the same PC (even in the DVD drive bay) as shown in this tutorial, which will not affect speed if C is on an SSD and the other drive is not:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/1964-move-u.... I would not move program files or speed will be affected. You could also install a larger SSD/HDD.This should make enough space to install Windows Updates. But I'd focus on the latest Version update since successfully installing it will bring along all Windows Updates and also resolves almost all other problems since it reinstalls Windows keeping your files and programs in place. Install the Media Creation Tool on another PC to create bootable media or download the ISO to stick or disk, transfer it back to the target PC to open the media or click to mount the ISO, right click Setup file to Run as Administrator. This avoids needing the space to download the Upgrade and it's staging files. http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Another option is to do the the best possible Clean Install in this link which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... This will give you back all but 15gb of the drive. There is also an automated Fresh Start that reinstalls WIndows while shedding corrupting factory bloatware, saves your files, but doesn't clear the drive to get it cleanest:https://www.howtogeek.com/265054/how-to-easily-... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Upgrading tablet to windows 10        I want to upgrade my Lenovo tablet from android to windows 10. I have a USB stick to download windows 10 for tablets to.Bob
solutions: I want to upgrade my Lenovo tablet from android to windows 10. I have windows 10 on my desktop and my laptop. Can I install it on a very basic Lenovo tablet. I have a USB stick to download windows 10 for tablets to then use for the installation if that is the procedure. Can this be accommodated? If so what is he cost? Do I have to download directly to my tablet? Bob

Hey Bob. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Android is a different operating system not compatible with WIndows, so unless the Lenovo says it runs Windows too it may not take Windows.Check the Lenovo Support webpage for your exact model to see if it can run Windows. If the device is within a year of purchase you still have Support warranty so can contact them to get guidance on this, including if a Windows license came with it in addition to Android. If so follow the illustrated steps in this link which compile the best possible Clean Install of Windows which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... To create bootable Windows 10 Installation Media (on another PC if necessary) install Media Creation Tool and follow the directions in the middle of the download page here:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Insert media, boot it by powering up PC while pressing the BIOS Boot Menu Key for your PC maker given in this chart:https://www.sysnative.com/forums/hardware-tutor... If the media won't boot you may need to enter BIOS/UEFI Setup (pressing key given in chart in link above) to turn off Fast Boot or Fast Startup first.Choose the boot device as a UEFI device if offered, then on second screen choose Install Now, then Custom Install, then at the drive selection screen delete all partitions down to Unallocated Space to get it cleanest, select the Unallocated Space, click Next to let it create and format the needed partitions and start install - this makes it foolproof.There is a step to rescue your files first using the booted media if you don't have them backed up:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... You will get and keep the best possible install to the exact extent you stick with the steps, tools and methods in the linked tutorial. It's a better install than any amount of money could buy and a great learning experience that will make you the master of your PC because you will learn everything that works best and how to apply it with your own hands.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Activation for Windows 10 S mode        Ok so I recently got an evoo 11.6 inch ultra thin laptop that runs windows 10 s. Ever since I got it I've gotten the message saying Activate Windows. When I go to activation settings it says "we can't activate windows on this device right now" and it gives me the error code 0xC004F025. Idk what to do please help
solutions: Hi hermanjacobs4. I'm Reinald, an Independent advisor and a Windows user like you. Thank you for providing information on your issue, we are are happy to assist you.I just need additional information so i can better assist you with your activation issue.A. Can you also do the instructions below and send us the screenshot. 1. Click Start > type CMD> Right click on "Command Prompt" and select Run as administrator > and type in the following command:slmgr.vbs /dlv 2. A "Windows Script Host" box will pop-up Check "Product Key Channel". IT should tell you what type of license do you have B. Also if you don't mind me asking, is the laptop brand new or purchased as 2nd hand?C. Have you already tried the activation troubleshooter? If not, kindly try it and let me know what happens.Go to Start > Settings > Update & Security > Activation > Scroll down and look for troubleshoot.Let us know how it goes and don't hesitate to ask if you have further questions. I will do my best to to assist you until your issue is resolved.
Thanks for answering so fast! The laptop is brand new and troubleshooting didnt work.
Can you also try the instructions i provided in letter A.
Also when I type cmd command prompt doesn't show up.

Hi hermanjacobs4, I'm an Independent Advisor and a Microsoft user like you. Please allow me to assist with your issue.I would suggest trying out Windows Activation Troubleshooter. Select Start > Settings > Update & Security > Activation , and then select Troubleshoot.For more detail on this solution, check out this article from a site that I like to use:https://support.microsoft.com/help/20527If you encounter further error messages, please post it as a screenshot here. Let me know if I can help you further!
When I use troubleshooter it says windows doesn't know what my problem is.

Hi Herman, You need to get out of S mode first before activating your Operating System. Please follow this article: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/445606...Please let me know if you need further assistance. Thanks and regards,

windows.symptom: Windows 10 BSoD post update                         I recently did a windows 10 update and now my surface comes up with the blue screen of death. I can only access the CMD prompt as all other alternatives for assistance has failed.Any ideas would be most helpfulThx
solutions: Hi Chris. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Unplug power and remove battery, press and hold power button for 30 seconds to release all power from circuitry, plug back in and power up to see if any change.I will give you steps to access the Repair Mode to try all repairs to get Windows started, and if not to do the automated Reset or the superior Clean Install after rescuing your files.1) Use whichever method works in this link to access Advanced Startup Options: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/2294-advanc.... Easiest may be to force shut down the PC (by holding in the power button) three separate times to trigger the Startup Options. If one of these methods work, then go to Step 3.2) If none of the other methods work it may be necessary to Create Windows 10 Installation Media on another PC following the steps in the middle of the downloads page here:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Make sure to uncheck the box for Recommended Settings to choose only the licensed version.Insert media, boot it by powering up PC while pressing the BIOS Boot Menu Key: https://www.sysnative.com/forums/hardware-tutor... Choose the boot device as a UEFI device if offered, then on second screen choose Repair Your Computer. If the media won't boot you may need to enter BIOS/UEFI Setup (pressing key given in chart in link above) to turn off Fast Boot or Fast Startup first. There is always a way to get the media booted and I will guide you until it does, even if necessary to reset the BIOS to defaults via several methods.3) In the Advanced Troubleshooting options try to System Restore to a point before the problems began, try the new Uninstall Updates button, then Startup Repair, then if necessary from Startup Settings try to get into Safe Mode with Networking, or lastly Safe Mode. If Startup Settings aren't available you can force Safe Mode from the Command Prompt following Step 5 here:https://www.digitalcitizen.life/4-ways-boot-saf..., or using the command to unhide F8 Advanced Boot Options here:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/22455-enabl... where you can also try the old reliable Last Known Good Configuration.4) From Safe Mode w/Networking work through the Windows 10 Install Integrity Checklist to make sure the install is set up correctly, optimized for best performance, and any needed repairs get done:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... 5) Update your drivers from the Surface Driver pack for your model here: https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/help/402348...Compare the latest drivers with the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu. Make sure you have the latest BIOS, Chipset, Display (Video), Sound, USB3, Bluetooth, Network and all other drivers, or else download and install the latest now. 6) If Safe Mode doesn’t work or help stabilize things then return to Advanced Troubleshoot options. Next try Command Prompt to run through Windows 10 Install Integrity Checklist (above link) Step 10 repair commands including sfc /scannow, DISM, a full Disk Check: https://www.groovypost.com/howto/check-hard-dri..., or return to Troubleshoot options to Reset Your Windows 10 PC.7) Better yet use the same booted media to do the vastly superior Clean Install following the steps in this link to delete all partitions down to Unallocated Space to get it cleanest:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... 8) There is a step to Rescue Files from the booted media or Repair Mode Command Prompt first:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... These steps are excerpted from my tutorial that compiles everything possible for Troubleshooting Windows 10 Failure to Start:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... You can continue with the other steps there.9) To test hardware, Dell and HP have onboard diagnostics triggered by powering up and pressing the F12 and ESC key respectively.10)Test the RAM overnight to stress it with the best bootable test memtest86, following these steps which test both the sticks and the slots:https://www.wikihow.com/Test-PC-RAM-with-MemTest8611) Test the hard drive with diagnostics: https://www.lifewire.com/free-hard-drive-testin...Best is to use the manufacturer's own if there is one, otherwise use Seatools bootable long test:http://blog.nowherelan.com/2013/04/04/boot-seat... Follow this up with a full Disk Check: https://www.groovypost.com/howto/check-hard-dri... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer There are links to a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Space        I finally bought an ssd card to do the latest windows 10 update.I was nervous after the last update when I completely lost my O/S when an external H/D became disconnected.It seems to have worked but the updated windows takes so much more space, I'm having problems running my 29gb laptop even after removing all my storage foldersWhat am I supposed to do.I can no longer go back to the old version as I removed it to free up space
solutions: You can get a larger m2 SSD installed or do a clean install removing all on the drive but you are getting close to the size of the Windows system files.

Hi J.B, It would be better if you will revert it and move your unnecessary files in an external drive.This actually worked for me, please follow this link for detailed guide: https://www.windowscentral.com/how-stop-updates...Disclaimer: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information that might solve your current issue.Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products).Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.Let us know if this helped you out. Your feedback is much appreciated. Thanks and regards,
